title: Sinaloid
notes:
Description

A regional variant within the broader Pueblid‑Mestizo category, shaped in the ranching–mining belt of northwest and north‑central Mexico by long‑term Spanish–Indigenous admixture. Skin: light‑ to medium‑brown and tans deeply. Build tends toward average height with a compact, stockier frame.

Traits

  • Faces often rounder in men and slightly longer in women; mild neoteny (soft, baby‑faced look) is common.
  • Nose medium and usually projecting; lips full.
  • Eyes predominantly dark and slightly upturned; lighter shades appear in a minority; occasional epicanthic folds.
  • Hair dark brown to black; straight or wavy; curls not rare.
